intro: Gerbera albicans, commonly known as the white gerbera, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its large, showy daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other similar species. Gerbera albicans typically grows in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and floral arrangements.
